title: How to Become Best Friends with a Guy over Text

steps.title: He’ll appreciate that you reached out and are interested in his day.
steps.content: He’ll appreciate that you reached out and are interested in his day. This works great for quickly checking in or jumping into a new conversation. Whenever he crosses your mind, send the guy a quick question to let him know you’re thinking about him. [1] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 July 2021. Some texts you could send include: [2] X Research source “Hey man, how’s your day been?” “What’ve you been up to lately?” “How’ve you been doing, dude?”

steps.title: Get him to talk more so you can have a deeper conversation.
steps.content: Get him to talk more so you can have a deeper conversation. Avoid asking yes/no questions since you may only get a 1-word reply that ends the conversation. Instead, get him to open up by asking a question that needs a more thoughtful answer. [3] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 July 2021. Start with some casual questions to make him feel comfortable and to get to know him a little better. [4] X Research source For example, you could ask something like, “What did you think of math class today?” rather than saying “Wasn’t math class really hard today?” Some other example questions you could try include, “What did you do this weekend?” or “What’s something that you’re really excited about?” Ask him some more personal questions as you grow closer. For example, you could ask some questions like, “What’s your best memory from growing up?” or, “How close are you to your family?” [5] X Research source

steps.title: Mentioning things he likes gives the guy an opportunity to talk.
steps.content: Mentioning things he likes gives the guy an opportunity to talk. If you don’t know what he likes, check his interests on social media or ask him directly so you can learn more about him. When you know the guy a little already, mention one of the things he loves with a follow-up question to encourage him to talk more. [6] X Research source For example, you could ask, “What are some of your favorite movies?” or “What do you like to do in your free time?” [7] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 July 2021. If you already know his interests, you could say something like, “You like The Office, right? What’s your favorite episode?” or, “How’d you get into skateboarding?”

steps.title: You’re more likely to become friends if you have something in common.
steps.content: You’re more likely to become friends if you have something in common. Once you know some things he’s passionate about, try to find something that you both like and have in common. [8] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 July 2021. Nerd out about the topic together and show that you’re excited by it. People are drawn to others with similar interests, so it gets a lot easier to build on your friendship [9] X Research source For example, you could say something like, “Oh I love soccer too! My favorite team is Arsenal, but who are you rooting for?” or, “I haven’t been on a hike in so long. What are your favorite trails around here?” You’re more likely to bond if you have unique interests rather than general ones. For example, you’re more likely to bond over French cuisine specifically rather than food in general.

steps.title: Balance the conversation so it doesn’t feel one-sided.
steps.content: Balance the conversation so it doesn’t feel one-sided. While it’s great that you’re learning more about the guy, he’ll want to know more about you too. When he asks you a question, open up and talk about it. If he doesn’t ask you anything, chime in after he responds to one of your questions so you talk equally. [10] X Research source For example, if you ask him about what it was like growing up, you may say, “My hometown was really small too. I would bike across town all the time with my friends.” Don’t be afraid to take the initiative with a funny anecdote or story. For example, you could say, “OMG you won’t believe what just happened when I was at the grocery store.” That way, you keep him guessing and he’ll want to know more.

steps.title: Show off your sense of humor to keep the conversation light.
steps.content: Show off your sense of humor to keep the conversation light. People that are funny tend to be more likable, so whip out your best jokes to make the guy laugh. Since it can be a little tough to gauge tone from a text message, use some emojis to lighten the mood and make it clear you aren’t being too serious. [11] X Research source If the guy can’t tell you’re joking, be sure to say something like, “Just to be clear, I was just kidding around! Sorry if it came out differently.”

steps.title: Goofy pictures work great whenever the guy needs a good laugh.
steps.content: Goofy pictures work great whenever the guy needs a good laugh. Look through social media sites or online to find images that you think the guy will find funny. Drop the image in your chat so the guy sees it and cheers up. He’ll really appreciate that you’re trying to make him smile and it’ll keep making your friendship grow. [12] X Research source You can also share videos from YouTube or TikTok as well. [13] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 July 2021. Be cautious sending memes to a guy you aren’t super close to since you may not know his sense of humor yet, and they could make him feel awkward.

steps.title: Try one when you need a fun break from regular conversation.
steps.content: Try one when you need a fun break from regular conversation. If you run out of things to say, suggest a game to play over text with the guy. There are a lot of different things you can try that help you learn more about the guy while you enjoy his company. A few games you could play include: [14] X Research source Would You Rather: take turns asking him to choose between 2 hypothetical scenarios, such as, “Would you rather go to the past to meet your ancestors or go to the future to see your descendants?” Never Have I Ever: alternate saying something you’ve never done, such as, “Never have I ever been outside of the country,” and if the other person has done it, they lose a point. Story Time: each person adds 1 sentence at a time to a story. For example, you could start, “Once upon a time, there was a prince,” and he may respond, “The prince lived in a big castle in the mountains.”

steps.title: Show how much you care for him with a few nice words.
steps.content: Show how much you care for him with a few nice words. Everyone loves to hear a little encouragement from their friends, so be sure to tell him what you appreciate about him. Be sincere and mention something specific to show that you’re paying attention to him. A few things you could try include: [15] X Research source “You did amazing on your presentation today! It was so intriguing!” “You’re so easy to talk to. I’d trust you with all my secrets.” “You’re so reliable. I appreciate you always having my back.” Reader Poll: We asked 336 wikiHow readers and 57% of them agreed that their favorite type of compliments to receive are ones about their character or personality . [Take Poll]

steps.title: He’ll be happy to know that you’re thinking of him throughout the day.
steps.content: He’ll be happy to know that you’re thinking of him throughout the day. If you see or do something that makes you think of the guy, shoot him a message about it. Just bring up what you were doing and how it reminded you of him. [16] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 29 July 2021. That way, you can stay connected and you have an easy conversation starter. [17] X Research source For example, you could say, “A few guys were playing basketball at the park today, and it made me remember how much you crushed me at one-on-one. We should play together again sometime!” You could also send him a picture or video of something. For example, if you find a street that has the same name as the guy, you could send a picture of the sign and say, “Look where I am! Wish you were here too!”

steps.title: Asking for his point of view lets him know you respect his opinions.
steps.content: Asking for his point of view lets him know you respect his opinions. If you’re struggling over a decision and don’t know what to do, run it by him and ask for help. Even if he doesn’t have the answers, going to him shows that you trust him a lot and encourages him to do the same. Just make sure you’re there to offer him advice if he asks for it in return. [18] X Research source For example, you could say something like, “Hey man, I’m not sure how to ask Mary out on a date. Can you give me a few pointers?” You don’t have to ask for big decisions. For example, you could say, “I want to see a movie this weekend, but they all look so good! Which one do you think I should watch?”

steps.title: Building a friendship gets a lot easier when you’re together.
steps.content: Building a friendship gets a lot easier when you’re together. It can be tough to develop a really strong bond when you don’t see each other in person. Ask him about his schedule and see if there’s any time he wants to get together to hang out. Plan something that’s fun for both of you so you each have a good time and grow your bond. [19] X Research source For example, you could say, “I was going to go bowling this weekend. Do you want to come along?” or “Do you want to grab a coffee after class and catch up?” If the guy lives far away and you can’t meet up, see if he wants to talk on the phone or do a video call.
